1997 Terrapin Invitational Tournament

The University of Maryland Academic Quiz Team announces that it will hold the Terrapin Invitational Tournament, now in its eleventh year at the College Park campus, on Friday, October 31, and Saturday, November 1, 1997.

Lord High Tournament Director of the Terrapin will be David Hamilton. Questions may be addressed by telephone to David at (301) 314-0033. E-mail inquiries (which are preferred) may be sent to dhamiltn@wam.umd.edu.

All teams are to be composed of either undergraduate students (full-time or part-time) or graduate students who attend the school for which they play. There is no limit on the number of graduate students allowed on a team. If a team wishes to compete with players from more than one school, that team will be ineligible for the championship (and playoffs, if they occur).

The fees are as follows:

  + $110 per team (don't be alarmed, there are plenty of discounts)
  + $10 late fee for questions arriving after 10/24 at 11:59:59 PM
  + $20 late fee for questions arriving after 10/29 at 11:59:59 PM
  + $20 for a copy of the rounds used in the 1997 Terrapin
We offer the following discounts:

  - $30 discount for attending both the Terrapin and the TRASH Regionals on November 2
  - $30 discount for questions received before 10/11 at 11:59:59 PM
  - $15 discount for questions received before 10/17 at 11:59:59 PM
  - $ 5 if your packet follows the ACF Nationals formatting guidelines
        (available upon request)
  - $10 maximum discount for a good packet
  - $10 discount for a working buzzer system
  - $10 for second team, third team, etc.
  - $10 per team if your school has not attended the Terrapin in the
        past three years (i.e., your school did not attend the Terrapin in 
        1994-1996)
  - $20 for first place team
  - $15 for second place team
  - $10 for third place team
Checks may be made payable to the Maryland Academic Quiz Team and sent to the address listed below: 

    Shaun Hayeslip
    2114 Anne Arundel Hall
    University of Maryland
    College Park, MD 20742
Questions should either be e-mailed as text or sent on disk as a Microsoft Word file (version 6.0 or higher) or in ASCII text.

We may be willing to extend credit based on the entrance fee to your tournament. We will trade rather than sell questions. Feel free to offer us deals.

In very rare cases, packet deadlines may be slightly negotiable.

What makes the Terrapin different from most other tournaments?

  • We offer a discount based on the quality of the packet submitted. We ask for 25 toss-ups and 25 bonus questions in the ACF format. If more than 80% of your submitted questions are usable, you get $5 back. If more than 90% are usable, we refund $10. Minor editing (e.g., fixing typos, reordering phrases, etc.) and repeats will not count against you. It is hoped that a discount of this nature will encourage quality submissions; please read Marc Swisdak's ACF Question Writing Guidelines (available here) to assist you in preparing your packet.
  • Difficulty level will be commensurate with ACF Regionals.
  • The Terrapin has consistently featured geographically diverse teams.
  • Tournament format will be round-robin. If bracketing is necessary, there will be a playoff round-robin similar to ACF Nationals.
  • Unlike most other tournaments, there will be trophies for the winning team and the runner-up.
  • Monetary awards can be given in cash or by check to avoid bureaucracy.
  • The Andy Sidaris Spectacular TRASH Regionals will be held on November 2. Teams attending both tournaments will receive a $30 discount on the total cost.
Question packets will be sold subject to the condition that they may not be placed on any archive site, photocopied, or redistributed without the express written authorization of the Maryland Academic Quiz Team for a period of one year.

David Hamilton
President, MAQT
